description: Panawala Widanalage Joseph Douglas Peiris and 04 others Vs Hon. Attorney General before Hon. Wickum A. Kaluarachchi, J.
parties: Panawala Widanalage Joseph Douglas Peiris and 04 others Vs Hon. Attorney General
keywords: Compliance with Section 196 of the Code of Criminal Procedure Act. - If failure to read the charge has not prejudiced the substantial rights of the parties or occasion a failure of justice, trial need not be vitiated. - Belatedness of making a complaint. - Accepting the depositions given by witnesses in a non-summary inquiry. - Requirements under Section 33 of the Evidence Ordinance.- Identification of the Accused. - Absence of cross-examination leads to the inference of an admission of a fact. - Applicability of the “Turnbull Guidelines” regarding identification. - Ingredients of the offence under Section 355 of the Penal Code. - Whether death of the victim should be proved to establish the offence of Abducting in order to Murder. - Circumstantial evidence. - Evaluation of voice identification evidence. - Doctrine of Common intention.
legistation: -Section 32, Section 355 of the Penal Code. -Section 196 of the Code of Criminal Procedure Act. -Section 33 of the Evidence Ordinance
